AIA Articles.Article_Name: Boeing reaches helo data accord with Air Force
AIA Articles.Article_Summary: Boeing has agreed to provide the US Air Force with technical data packages for two new helicopters, the HH-60W Jolly Green II and the MH-139A Grey Wolf. The HH-60W Jolly Green II is now in full-rate production, while the MH-139A Grey Wolf is currently in the developmental testing phase.

AIA Articles.Article_Name: Kratos, Hypersonix team enters US hypersonics market
AIA Articles.Article_Summary: Kratos Defense and Security Solutions has teamed up with Australia's Hypersonix to collaborate on hypersonic technologies for the US defense market. Kratos will buy 20 Hypersonix DART AE hypersonic vehicles once following development and integrate them with Kratos' Zeus propulsion systems.

AIA Articles.Article_Name: Northrop enables automated software updates for B-2
AIA Articles.Article_Summary: Northrop Grumman has demonstrated a new mission update system for the B-2 bomber. The Integrated Airborne Mission Transfer system allows new mission parameters to be fed directly into the B-2's computers without manual input from pilots, speeding up the process and reducing the chance of errors.

AIA Articles.Article_Name: Boeing performs advanced upgrades on P-8
AIA Articles.Article_Summary: Boeing has secured a $145.7 million contract to perform engineering and manufacturing development upgrades for a fleet of P-8 aircraft trainers for the US Navy and Air Force. The enhancements include both hardware and software updates, aiming to elevate training systems and improve operational proficiency and readiness.

AIA Articles.Article_Name: QinetiQ, BAE fly new testbed for UK defense projects
AIA Articles.Article_Summary: QinetiQ and BAE Systems have successfully conducted a flight test featuring a fast jet radome installed on the RJ100, marking a significant advancement in radar and sensor integration capabilities for future aerospace programs. Backed by the Long Term Partnering Agreement with the UK Ministry of Defense, the trial strengthens UK flight test capabilities.

The Cessna SkyCourier twin turboprop utility aircraft has received type certification from Brazil's National Civil Aviation Authority, granting it access to the Brazilian aviation market. The SkyCourier was previously certified by the US Federal Aviation Administration.

AIA Articles.Article_Name: United continues supporting sustainable fuel investment
AIA Articles.Article_Summary: Within five months, United Airlines sustainable aviation fuel investment fund with $100 million has doubled in size, and the new investors include JetBlue, Hawaiian Airlines and Air Canada. "My biggest priority right now is to figure out how we can lend United's credibility to establish a market for SAF," said Lauren Riley, United's chief sustainability officer.

AIA Articles.Article_Name: LG Chem, Neste sign supply deal for SAF
AIA Articles.Article_Summary: South Korea's LG Chem is in talks with Neste on a long-term supply deal for waste cooking oil, which LG Chem plans to use in sustainable aviation fuel. Neste will also supply biobased ingredients for LG Chem  to produce bioplastic products, including acrylonitrile butadiene styrene for use in home appliances and toys, polyvinyl chloride for flooring and an absorbent polymer for diapers.

AIA Articles.Article_Name: Biden administration disrupts private investment in China
AIA Articles.Article_Summary: President Joe Biden has signed an executive order banning new American investment in key Chinese technology industries, including semiconductors, microelectronics, quantum computers, and certain artificial intelligence applications. The move is aimed at preventing these technologies from enhancing Beijing's military capabilities and is framed as a measure to guard national security.
